results.title: Ross Gibson interview Tape #2
results.brief_description:
Interview Date: 22nd March, 2002.
Ross Gibson discusses a number of issues relating to the curatorial background and philosophy of assembling the ACMI collection. Ross also discusses the approach taken by ACMI staff to generating content and assembling the collection with the viewer’s experience in mind. Other topics of discussion relate to the genesis of Ross’ involvement with the project, an overview of his work while Creative Director of ACMI, and a discussion of specific works in the permanent collection of exemplary works.

results.title: Ross Bridge
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Norman Laird and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Historic Ross Bridge, in Tasmania, and the excellent craftsmanship of its stone figures by the enigmatic and gifted sculptor, Daniel Herbert.

results.title: Rosie's walk
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: To the tune of “Turkey In The Straw”, the little red hen Rosie struts across the barnyard keeping her country cool, while unknowingly leading a stalking fox into one disaster after another. The spirited country music accompanying Pat Hutchins’ colourful illustrations make this suspenseful story a delightful fast-moving film.

results.title: Roses are red
results.creator_credit: Marcella Hayward, Robert Connolly and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two parking cops (Jacqueline McKenzie and Kris McQuade) journey into the night with the reality of their work weighing heavy whilst they dream of love. Enter Brian (David Wenham) who thinks it is even tougher being a flower seller and the last thing he needs is a parking ticket. This is a delightful comedy that evokes the banalities, difficulties and romance in everyday life.

results.title: Roses
results.brief_description: A woman who lives in a retirement home keeps returning back to the place where she moved out from to tend to the roses, and catch up with her next door neighbour. The flowers are the old woman’s only continuum between past and present, as she struggles to find a way to reclaim what was once hers in the garden that she nurtured when she was independent and self sufficient. Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Lois Ramsey, Lindy Sardelic and Liz Burch.

results.title: Roots of plants
results.brief_description: Various forms of roots are first presented. Time-lapse and micro-photography are employed to bring out the interesting processes of growth and the structure of the roots of plants. Animation is used to demonstrate osmosis.

results.title: Roots
results.brief_description: A remarkable film for its time which shows, by time-lapse microcinematography and the use of animation, details never before achieved of the processes of root growth. Photography by Percy Smith.

results.title: Room to learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joyce Chopra and Early Learning Centrer
results.brief_description: Shows an outstanding preschool facility - the Early Learning Center, Connecticut, whose design is based on the Montessori philosophy that the environment of early schooling affects a child’s learning processes over a lifetime.
